isis.stitle: TSI 01-08-07 - Reading and Clearing Vehicle On-Board DTC's (Diagnostic Trouble Codes)

subjectgroup.subject: Reading and Clearing Vehicle On-Board DTC's (Diagnostic Trouble Codes)

geninfo.para: The 4300/4400 models incorporate significantly enhanced electrical/electronic systems with extensive self-diagnostics. Some of the areas monitored are: Electronic Gauge Cluster (EGC), Electrical System Controller (ESC), numerous switches & relays, HVAC controls, circuit overloads/underloads, Power Window modules, Remote Power Modules (RPM's), Remote Engine Speed Control module and Remote Air Solenoid modules. Diagnostic Trouble Codes (DTC's) can be viewed using the odometer LCD readout in the EGC. If you are experiencing an electrical problem, it is recommended that you check for and record any DTC's before contacting your dealer. Based on the DTC's, your dealer can advise you of the nature of the problem and schedule a repair date that best minimizes vehicle downtime.

svcproc.title: Service Procedure

step1.para: Begin procedure with the engine off and the parking brake applied.
Turn the ignition to the "ON" position but do not start engine.
The EGC will go through its power-on-self-test and the LCD readout will display the EGC software version number.
Verify that the parking brake light is on.
Simultaneously depress the cruise "ON" and cruise "RESUME" switches.
If no DTC's are present, the LCD readout will display "NO FAULTS".
If DTC's are present, the LCD readout will first display the total number of "A"ctive and "P"reviously Active faults.
After approximately 10 seconds, each DTC will display for approximately 10 seconds.
The Select/Reset button on the EGC can also be used to manually scroll through the DTC's.
When in the diagnostic mode, any International Engine fault codes or any ABS (Antilock Brake System) fault codes will flash on their respective lights.

Read the numbers across the bottom line left to right first, then read the numbers on the next line above left to right. The "A" or "P" on the far right of the bottom line indicates whether the DTC is "A"ctive and "P"reviously Active.
This DTC would be read as: 612-14-12-1 A

svcproc.para: Caution: Clearing "Previously Active" DTC's may result in losing useful diagnostic information.

item.para: The EGC must be in the diagnostic mode.
Place turn signal in left turn position.
Simultaneously depress the cruise "ON" and cruise "SET" switches.
If there are no "Active" DTC's, the LCD readout should now display "NO FAULTS."
This procedure will not clear "Active" DTC's, Engine fault codes or ABS fault codes.
To exit the diagnostic mode, turn ignition key off, release parking brake or start engine.
